alert.note: Alert for Clark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 2:16PM EST until February 23 at 5:19AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers... Mad River at Springfield. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mad River at Springfield. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, West 1st Street in Springfield Township floods, including the Forest Lake Fishing and Campround area, with water approaching some businesses along West 1st Street. Spangler Road downstream of Springfield also floods. Flood waters approach several homes to the southwest of Springfield. In addition, the Mad River experiences widespread flooding in Champaign County near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 10.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
